page.title: 02Present settlement
page.content:
Present Settlement.
The parish of Salehurst is quite large but it is the village of Robertsbridge,within the parish,that has grown as the main built-up area. Communications are good.The present main line railway station is within 1/2mile of the centre and the main road from Hastings to London passes through the village. The land-use is mixed with good farming land being used for arable and pastoral farming.Hops are grown in the area. Trade in the area is established.Gray-Nicolls,the famous cricket manufacturers,have had a factory in the village for over 100years.There has been a grain mill here since almost 1086. There are many clubs and societies.
